pullRequest.body:
Compute the antidiagonal of divisors of an integer `z`, namely the finset of pairs `(a, b) : â„¤ Ã— â„¤` such that `a * b = n` (unless `z = 0`, in which case we set the finset to be empty by convention).


---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors r-
Canceled.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13369975615/job/37336158786)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13369975615/job/37336159152)

LGTM otherwise!

bors d+

Some more (simp) lemma ideas:
* `divisorsAntidiag (-z) = (divisorsAntidiag z).map _`
* `divisorsAntidiag (ofNat(n)) = disjUnion (Nat.divisorsAntidiag n).map ...`

LGTM otherwise!

bors d+
I put it to you that "$O(n)$." is not a full sentence.
I am following the convention established by https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Data/List/Basic.html#List.range

```suggestion
O(|z|). Computed from `Nat.divisorsAntidiagonal`. -/
def divisorsAntidiag : (z : â„¤) â†’ Finset (â„¤ Ã— â„¤)
```
otherwise the variable in the docstring doesn't exist.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma divisorsAntidiag_zero : divisorsAntidiag 0 = âˆ… := rfl
```
Could you prove `swap_mem_divisorsAntidiagonal` and `map_swap_divisorsAntidiagonal` as well?

Do we also want
```lean
theorem Int.prodMk_mem_divisorsAntidiagonal_iff {x y z : â„¤} (hz : z â‰  0):
    (x, y) âˆˆ Int.divisorsAntidiagonal z â†” x * y = z := by
  rw [Int.mem_divisorsAntidiagonal_iff]
  simp [hz]
```
from the zulip thread?
These are probably worth a `--` comment
This one we don't have for `Nat.divisorsAntidiag; could you add it?

```suggestion
  ext; exact swap_mem_divisorsAntidiag
```
(untested)
Membership of `map` is an `Exists`
I guess you could add a `map Equiv.neg` version too
This isn't really an `aux` lemma. Can we just use prime? Also, can you please specify in the docstring that you mean the LHS is the simp normal form?
I was following the nat version of the lemma
I've prefixed `_simpNF` instead to show this isn't a lemma people should use by hand. Can you check you're happy with it. If so, feel free to merge

I know this was already here, but the "As a special case, ..." seems a strange way to phrase it. I liked what you said in the PR description better. So maybe this?
```suggestion
`n.divisorsAntidiagonal` is the finset of pairs `(a, b) : â„• Ã— â„•` such that `a * b = n`.
By convention, we choose `Nat.divisorsAntidiagonal 0 = âˆ…`.
```

```suggestion
`z.divisorsAntidiag` is the finset of pairs `(a, b) : â„¤ Ã— â„¤` such that `a * b = z`.
By convention, we choose `Int.divisorsAntidiag 0 = âˆ…`.
```

Why do we even care about this lemma existing? The RHS is not simp-normal form either.

I suspect it would be easier to just put `@[simp high]` on `swap_mem_divisorsAntidiag` and be done with it.
I tend to agree. Would be good to acquire a guideline here

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: finset of pairs of divisors of an integer
